meanings.definition: A rounded underground storage organ present in some plants, consisting of a short stem surrounded by fleshy scale leaves or leaf bases.
meanings.sent1: The tulip bulb was planted in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully dug up the flower bulb.
meanings.sent3: Why did the onion bulb bring a shovel to the garden party? To dig up some dirt!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas bloomed from the bulb of creativity within her mind.
meanings.sent5: The bulb held the plant's future, waiting to sprout and grow.

meanings.sent1: The room brightened up as the bulb was turned on.
meanings.sent2: He replaced the burnt-out bulb with a new one.
meanings.sent3: Why did the light bulb go to school? To get brighter!
meanings.sent4: The idea lit up in his mind like a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent5: The bulb illuminated the dark room, revealing hidden treasures.

meanings.sent1: The balloon had a round bulb at the end.
meanings.sent2: She admired the elegant shape of the glass bulb.
meanings.sent3: Why did the round bulb refuse to roll? It didn't want to be a square!
meanings.sent4: The moon shone like a giant bulb in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The bulbous figure stood out among the crowd, drawing everyone's attention.
